verses.sanskrit:
प्रणम्य शिरसा देवं गौरीपुत्रं विनायकम्।
भक्तावासं स्मरेन्नित्यमायुःकामार्थसिद्धये॥
verses.transliteration:
praṇamya śirasā devaṃ gaurīputraṃ vināyakam।
bhaktāvāsaṃ smarennityamāyuḥkāmārthasiddhaye॥
verses.meaning: Bowing my head to the divine Lord Vinayaka, son of Gauri, the refuge of devotees, I constantly remember Him for the attainment of longevity, desires and wealth.

verses.sanskrit:
प्रथमं वक्रतुण्डं च एकदन्तं द्वितीयकम्।
तृतीयं कृष्णपिङ्गाक्षं गजवक्त्रं चतुर्थकम्॥
verses.transliteration:
prathamaṃ vakratuṇḍaṃ ca ekadantaṃ dvitīyakam।
tṛtīyaṃ kṛṣṇapiṅgākṣaṃ gajavaktraṃ caturthakam॥
verses.meaning: First as the one with the curved trunk, second as the one-tusked Lord, third as the one with reddish-black eyes, fourth as the one with the elephant face.

verses.sanskrit:
लम्बोदरं पञ्चमं च षष्ठं विकटमेव च।
सप्तमं विघ्नराजं च धूम्रवर्णं तथाष्टमम्॥
verses.transliteration:
lambodaraṃ pañcamaṃ ca ṣaṣṭhaṃ vikaṭameva ca।
saptamaṃ vighnarājaṃ ca dhūmravarṇaṃ tathāṣṭamam॥
verses.meaning: Fifth as the pot-bellied one, sixth as the fearsome one, seventh as the king who removes obstacles, eighth as the smoke-colored one.

verses.sanskrit:
नवमं भालचन्द्रं च दशमं तु विनायकम्।
एकादशं गणपतिं द्वादशं तु गजाननम्॥
verses.transliteration:
navamaṃ bhālacandraṃ ca daśamaṃ tu vināyakam।
ekādaśaṃ gaṇapatiṃ dvādaśaṃ tu gajānanam॥
verses.meaning: Ninth as the moon-crested one, tenth as the remover of obstacles, eleventh as the Lord of hosts, twelfth as the elephant-faced one.

verses.sanskrit:
द्वादशैतानि नामानि त्रिसन्ध्यं यः पठेन्नरः।
न च विघ्नभयं तस्य सर्वसिद्धिकरं प्रभुः॥
verses.transliteration:
dvādaśaitāni nāmāni trisandhyaṃ yaḥ paṭhennaraḥ।
na ca vighnabhayaṃ tasya sarvasiddhikaraṃ prabhuḥ॥
verses.meaning: One who recites these twelve names at the three junctures of the day (dawn, noon, dusk) will have no fear of obstacles, and the Lord will grant all accomplishments.

verses.sanskrit:
विद्यार्थी लभते विद्यां धनार्थी लभते धनम्।
पुत्रार्थी लभते पुत्रान्मोक्षार्थी लभते गतिम्॥
verses.transliteration:
vidyārthī labhate vidyāṃ dhanārthī labhate dhanam।
putrārthī labhate putrānmokṣārthī labhate gatim॥
verses.meaning: A student gains knowledge, one seeking wealth gains riches, one desiring children gains sons, and one seeking liberation attains the supreme goal.

verses.sanskrit:
जपेत् गणपतिस्तोत्रं षड्भिर्मासैः फलं लभेत्।
संवत्सरेण सिद्धिं च लभते नात्र संशयः॥
verses.transliteration:
japet gaṇapatistotraṃ ṣaḍbhirmāsaiḥ phalaṃ labhet।
saṃvatsareṇa siddhiṃ ca labhate nātra saṃśayaḥ॥
verses.meaning: One who chants this Ganapati stotra obtains results within six months, and attains complete success within a year - there is no doubt about this.

verses.sanskrit:
अष्टभ्यो ब्राह्मणेभ्यश्च लिखित्वा यः समर्पयेत्।
तस्य विद्या भवेत्सर्वा गणेशस्य प्रसादतः॥
verses.transliteration:
aṣṭabhyo brāhmaṇebhyaśca likhitvā yaḥ samarpayet।
tasya vidyā bhavetsarvā gaṇeśasya prasādataḥ॥
verses.meaning: One who writes this stotra and offers it to eight learned people will gain all knowledge by the grace of Lord Ganesha.
Thus ends the Sankat Nashan Ganesh Stotram from the Sri Narada Purana.
